funders_investors.description: Funders and investors are invited to help Fahe raise $3 billion by 2030 to build 60,000 homes in Appalachia, supporting local leaders and community services.

faqs.question: How can I invest in or fund the Housing Can’t Wait campaign?
faqs.answer: You can partner with Fahe to help raise $3 billion by 2030, supporting the construction and rehabilitation of 60,000 homes and providing community services to benefit 1 million people. Opportunities include philanthropic donations, impact investments, and more. Learn how to partner: https://www.housingcantwait.org/join-us/

faqs.question: What is the goal of the Housing Can’t Wait campaign?
faqs.answer: The campaign aims to double Fahe’s impact in Appalachia by 2030, building or rehabilitating 60,000 homes and providing services to 1 million people, with a fundraising goal of $3 billion from investors, funders, and donors.

faqs.question: Who benefits from my investment?
faqs.answer: Your investment supports local leaders who are building and rehabilitating homes, strengthening entire towns, and providing stability for families across Appalachia.

policymakers_advocates.description: Fahe collaborates with policymakers and advocates to increase state-level housing investment and influence housing equity policy.

faqs.question: How does Fahe work with policymakers and advocates?
faqs.answer: Fahe collaborates with policymakers to increase state-level housing investment and influence housing equity policy, aiming to create lasting economic and housing opportunities for underserved communities. Learn how to advocate: https://www.housingcantwait.org/join-us/

faqs.question: What impact has Fahe had on housing policy?
faqs.answer: For over 45 years, Fahe has led efforts to solve housing challenges in rural and hard-to-serve areas, investing billions into communities and influencing policy to benefit families and entire towns.

local_governments.description: Fahe partners with local governments on disaster recovery and housing initiatives, including Community Development Block Grant Disaster Recovery (CDBG-DR) programs.

faqs.question: How can local governments collaborate with Fahe on disaster recovery?
faqs.answer: Local governments can partner with Fahe on disaster recovery and housing initiatives, including CDBG-DR programs. Learn more about recovery efforts and how your community can participate: https://www.housingcantwait.org/recovery/

faqs.question: What support is available for communities impacted by disasters?
faqs.answer: Fahe provides support for disaster-impacted communities, prioritizing those affected by the 2021, 2022, and 2025 Eastern Kentucky floods. Residents and local governments can learn about eligibility and available programs on the website.

corporations.description: Corporations can become brand partners and support regional reinvestment, helping to build and rehabilitate homes in Appalachia.

faqs.question: How can my company partner with the Housing Can’t Wait campaign?
faqs.answer: Corporations can become brand partners and support regional reinvestment. Learn how your company can make a difference: https://www.housingcantwait.org/join-us/

faqs.question: What are the benefits of corporate partnership?
faqs.answer: Corporate partners help build and rehabilitate homes, strengthen communities, and demonstrate a commitment to social responsibility in Appalachia.

residents.description: Residents of disaster-impacted areas, especially those affected by recent Eastern Kentucky floods, can apply for housing support through Fahe’s programs.

faqs.question: I was affected by the Eastern Kentucky floods. How can I get housing support?
faqs.answer: If you live in a disaster-impacted area and need housing support, please fill out the Disaster Recovery Interest Form at https://www.housingcantwait.org/interest-form/. A Fahe Disaster Resilience Team Member will review your information and reach out to you for next steps.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for disaster recovery housing programs?
faqs.answer: Residents of 2021, 2022, and 2025 Eastern Kentucky floods may be eligible for Community Development Block Grant Disaster Recovery (CDBG-DR) housing programs. Disaster impact is prioritized, but not required. To get started, fill out the Disaster Recovery Interest Form at https://www.housingcantwait.org/interest-form/.

faqs.question: How do I get help if I lost my house in a flood?
faqs.answer: If you lost your house in a flood or were otherwise impacted by a disaster, please fill out the Disaster Recovery Interest Form at https://www.housingcantwait.org/interest-form/. This form will be reviewed for eligibility into a CDBG-DR Housing Program, and a Fahe Disaster Resilience Team Member will contact you for additional information and next steps.

faqs.question: What is Fahe?
faqs.answer:
Fahe stands for the Federation of Appalachian Housing Enterprises. Fahe is a network of 50+ Members across Alabama, Kentucky, Maryland, Tennessee, Virginia, and West Virginia. We use our expertise in finance, collaboration, innovation, advocacy, and communication to achieve a more prosperous Appalachian region.

With a focus on leadership, housing, education, health and social services, and economic opportunity, Fahe empowers the people and communities of Appalachia with the resources, opportunities, and tools needed to build a better life. Our strength in numbers is transforming Appalachia into a place where economic opportunity and stability are within reach for all.
Learn more about Fahe at: https://fahe.org/about/
